title: Genealogy of Benjamin
shortSummary: 1 Chronicles 8 details the genealogy of the tribe of Benjamin, tracing the descendants from Benjamin himself through multiple generations. This chapter highlights the importance of family lineage in God's plan and preserves the heritage of one of Israel's key tribes, including the lineage of King Saul.
timeline: c. 1050 BC - Period of the Judges transitioning to the United Monarchy

keyCharacters.name: Benjamin
keyCharacters.description: The youngest son of Jacob and founder of the tribe of Benjamin, whose descendants are listed in this chapter.

keyCharacters.name: Bela
keyCharacters.description: Firstborn son of Benjamin, whose descendants are detailed as heads of families within the tribe.

keyCharacters.name: Saul
keyCharacters.description: The first king of Israel, descended from Benjamin through Ner and Kish, mentioned here to establish his tribal lineage.

keyCharacters.name: Kish
keyCharacters.description: Father of Saul, a key figure linking the tribe of Benjamin to the monarchy.

definitions.definition: An archaic term meaning 'to father' or 'to produce offspring,' used here to indicate lineage.
Leaders or chiefs of family groups or clans within the tribe, responsible for governance and representation.
Warriors known for their bravery and strength, often serving as elite fighters or leaders in battle.
Skilled warriors who use bows and arrows, important in ancient warfare for ranged attacks.

outline.heading: Descendants of Benjamin
outline.description: This section lists the sons of Benjamin, focusing on Bela and his descendants, establishing the foundational family lines of the tribe.

outline.heading: Families and Settlements
outline.description: Details the heads of families and their settlements, including those who lived in Jerusalem and Gibeon, emphasizing the tribe's distribution and leadership.

outline.heading: Lineage of Saul
outline.description: Focuses on the genealogy leading to Saul, Israel’s first king, underscoring the divine providence in his tribal heritage.

outline.heading: Descendants and Warriors
outline.description: Lists the descendants of Micah and others, highlighting the presence of mighty men and archers within Benjamin, signifying the tribe’s military strength.

application: Recognize the importance of honoring and understanding your spiritual heritage as part of God's unfolding plan.
Value godly leadership and the role of family in nurturing faith and obedience to God.
Trust that God sovereignly establishes leaders and warriors for His purposes, encouraging faithfulness in service.
Commit to living faithfully within your community, knowing that God uses families and tribes to accomplish His will.

keyVerses.text: And Ner begat Kish, and Kish begat Saul, and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
keyVerses.significance: This verse is crucial as it traces the lineage of Israel’s first king, Saul, highlighting God's providential choice through the tribe of Benjamin.

keyVerses.text: And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valour, archers, and had many sons, and sons' sons, an hundred and fifty. All these are of the sons of Benjamin.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the strength and valor of Benjamin’s descendants, showing the tribe’s significant role in Israel’s military history.
